Actinobacillus Pleuropneumonia.recommendation: This is a serious respiratory infection in pigs. Seek immediate veterinary attention as it can be fatal without proper treatment.
Actinobacillus Pleuropneumonia.description: Bacterial respiratory infection causing severe pneumonia

Bluetongue.recommendation: Contact a veterinarian immediately. This viral disease affects ruminants and can be fatal.
Bluetongue.description: Viral disease causing fever, swelling, and blue discoloration of tongue

Bovine Johne's Disease.recommendation: This chronic bacterial infection requires immediate veterinary diagnosis and management. It's highly contagious among cattle.
Bovine Johne's Disease.description: Chronic bacterial infection of the intestines causing weight loss and diarrhea

Bovine Respiratory Disease.recommendation: Schedule a veterinary visit within 24-48 hours. Monitor breathing and temperature closely.
Bovine Respiratory Disease.description: Complex of respiratory infections common in cattle

Bovine Respiratory Disease Complex.recommendation: Requires veterinary attention within 24 hours. Can progress rapidly if untreated.
Bovine Respiratory Disease Complex.description: Multiple respiratory pathogens affecting cattle simultaneously

Bovine Respiratory Syncytial Virus.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian within 24 hours. Monitor for breathing difficulties and fever.
Bovine Respiratory Syncytial Virus.description: Viral respiratory infection causing coughing and breathing difficulties

Bovine Tuberculosis.recommendation: This is a serious zoonotic disease. Contact a veterinarian immediately and follow quarantine protocols.
Bovine Tuberculosis.description: Bacterial infection that can spread to humans and other animals

Bovine Viral Diarrhea.recommendation: Schedule veterinary examination within 24-48 hours. Ensure proper hydration and isolation.
Bovine Viral Diarrhea.description: Viral infection causing diarrhea, fever, and reproductive issues

Canine Distemper.recommendation: Take your dog to the nearest emergency clinic immediately. This is a life-threatening viral disease.
Canine Distemper.description: Highly contagious viral disease affecting multiple organ systems

Canine Hepatitis.recommendation: Seek immediate veterinary care. This viral infection can cause liver failure and death.
Canine Hepatitis.description: Viral infection affecting the liver, kidneys, and other organs

Canine Leptospirosis.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This bacterial infection can be transmitted to humans.
Canine Leptospirosis.description: Bacterial infection affecting kidneys and liver, transmissible to humans

Canine Parvovirus.recommendation: Rush to the nearest emergency veterinary clinic immediately. Parvovirus can be fatal within hours, especially in puppies.
Canine Parvovirus.description: Highly contagious viral infection causing severe vomiting and diarrhea

Caprine Arthritis Encephalitis.recommendation: Schedule a veterinary visit within 2-3 days. This chronic condition requires ongoing management.
Caprine Arthritis Encephalitis.description: Chronic viral infection causing arthritis and neurological symptoms

Caprine Pleuropneumonia.recommendation: Contact a veterinarian immediately. This respiratory infection can be fatal in goats.
Caprine Pleuropneumonia.description: Bacterial respiratory infection causing severe pneumonia in goats

Caprine Respiratory Disease.recommendation: Schedule veterinary examination within 24 hours. Monitor breathing and provide supportive care.

Coccidiosis.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian within 24-48 hours. Ensure proper hydration and sanitation.
Coccidiosis.description: Parasitic infection of the intestines causing diarrhea

Equine Arthritis.recommendation: Schedule a veterinary consultation within a week. Provide rest and monitor mobility.
Equine Arthritis.description: Joint inflammation causing stiffness and lameness

Equine Encephalomyelitis.recommendation: Contact an equine veterinarian immediately. This neurological condition can be life-threatening.
Equine Encephalomyelitis.description: Viral infection of the brain and spinal cord

Equine Herpesvirus.recommendation: Schedule veterinary visit within 24 hours. Isolate the horse and monitor for neurological signs.
Equine Herpesvirus.description: Viral infection causing respiratory and neurological symptoms

Equine Infectious Anemia.recommendation: Contact a veterinarian immediately. This is a reportable disease requiring quarantine measures.
Equine Infectious Anemia.description: Viral blood disease causing anemia and weakness

Equine Influenza.recommendation: Schedule veterinary examination within 24 hours. Provide rest and monitor temperature.

Equine Laminitis.recommendation: Call an equine veterinarian immediately. This painful foot condition requires emergency treatment.
Equine Laminitis.description: Inflammation of the laminae in the hoof causing severe pain

Equine Protozoal Myeloencephalitis.recommendation: Contact an equine neurologist immediately. This progressive neurological disease requires specialized treatment.
Equine Protozoal Myeloencephalitis.description: Parasitic infection of the central nervous system

Equine Rhinopneumonitis.recommendation: Schedule veterinary visit within 24 hours. Isolate the horse and monitor for complications.
Equine Rhinopneumonitis.description: Viral respiratory infection that can cause abortion in mares

Feline Asthma.recommendation: Schedule veterinary visit within 24-48 hours. Monitor breathing and avoid triggers.
Feline Asthma.description: Chronic respiratory condition causing breathing difficulties

Feline Calicivirus.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian within 24 hours. Provide supportive care and monitor eating.
Feline Calicivirus.description: Viral infection causing oral ulcers and respiratory symptoms

Feline Herpesvirus.recommendation: Schedule veterinary visit within 2-3 days. Provide supportive care and monitor eye discharge.
Feline Herpesvirus.description: Viral infection causing respiratory and eye symptoms

Feline Infectious Peritonitis.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This is a serious viral disease with poor prognosis.
Feline Infectious Peritonitis.description: Fatal viral disease causing inflammation of body cavities

Feline Leukemia Virus.recommendation: Schedule veterinary examination within 24 hours. This immunosuppressive virus requires ongoing management.
Feline Leukemia Virus.description: Viral infection causing immunosuppression and cancer

Feline Panleukopenia.recommendation: Take your cat to the emergency clinic immediately. This is highly contagious and often fatal.
Feline Panleukopenia.description: Highly contagious viral infection causing severe vomiting and diarrhea

Feline Upper Respiratory Infection.recommendation: Monitor closely for 2-3 days. If symptoms worsen or persist beyond a week, contact your veterinarian.
Feline Upper Respiratory Infection.description: Common viral or bacterial infection of the upper respiratory tract

Foot and Mouth Disease.recommendation: Contact authorities and veterinarian immediately. This is a highly contagious reportable disease.
Foot and Mouth Disease.description: Highly contagious viral disease affecting cloven-hoofed animals

Foot-and-Mouth Disease.recommendation: Contact authorities and veterinarian immediately. This is a highly contagious reportable disease.
Foot-and-Mouth Disease.description: Highly contagious viral disease affecting cloven-hoofed animals

Gastroenteritis.recommendation: Monitor for 24 hours. If vomiting/diarrhea persists or animal becomes lethargic, contact your veterinarian.
Gastroenteritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines causing digestive upset

Johne's Disease.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This chronic bacterial infection requires specialized testing and management.
Johne's Disease.description: Chronic bacterial infection causing progressive weight loss and diarrhea

Kennel Cough.recommendation: Symptoms may resolve in 1-2 weeks with rest. Contact your veterinarian if coughing persists or worsens.
Kennel Cough.description: Highly contagious respiratory infection causing persistent cough

Mastitis.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian within 24 hours. Monitor udder for heat, swelling, and milk quality.
Mastitis.description: Bacterial infection of the mammary gland

Myxomatosis.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This viral disease is often fatal in rabbits.
Myxomatosis.description: Viral disease causing swelling and skin lesions, often fatal

Pancreatitis.recommendation: Take your pet to the emergency clinic immediately. This condition can be life-threatening.
Pancreatitis.description: Inflammation of the pancreas causing severe abdominal pain

Panleukopenia.recommendation: Rush to the nearest emergency veterinary clinic immediately. This is often fatal without immediate treatment.
Panleukopenia.description: Highly contagious viral infection causing severe immune suppression

Parvovirus.recommendation: Take your pet to the nearest emergency clinic immediately. Parvovirus can be fatal within hours.
Parvovirus.description: Highly contagious viral infection causing severe dehydration and shock

Pasteurellosis.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian within 24 hours. This bacterial infection responds well to antibiotics.
Pasteurellosis.description: Bacterial infection causing respiratory and other symptoms

Pneumonia.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. Pneumonia can be life-threatening and requires prompt treatment.
Pneumonia.description: Infection of the lungs causing breathing difficulties

Porcine Epidemic Diarrhea.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This highly contagious viral disease can cause high mortality in piglets.
Porcine Epidemic Diarrhea.description: Highly contagious viral infection causing severe diarrhea and dehydration

Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This viral disease is often rapidly fatal in rabbits.
Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease.description: Highly contagious viral disease causing sudden death

Rabbit Syphilis.recommendation: Schedule veterinary visit within 2-3 days. This bacterial infection is treatable with antibiotics.
Rabbit Syphilis.description: Bacterial infection causing skin lesions around genitals

Rabbit Viral Hemorrhagic Disease.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This is a reportable disease with high mortality rates.
Rabbit Viral Hemorrhagic Disease.description: Rapidly fatal viral disease causing internal bleeding

Scrapie.recommendation: Contact authorities and veterinarian immediately. This is a reportable neurological disease.
Scrapie.description: Progressive neurological disease affecting the central nervous system

Swine Erysipelas.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian immediately. This bacterial infection can cause sudden death in pigs.
Swine Erysipelas.description: Bacterial infection causing skin lesions and systemic illness

Swine Fever.recommendation: Contact authorities and veterinarian immediately. This is a highly contagious reportable disease.
Swine Fever.description: Highly contagious viral disease with high mortality rates

Swine Influenza.recommendation: Contact your veterinarian within 24 hours. Monitor temperature and provide supportive care.
Swine Influenza.description: Viral respiratory infection causing fever and breathing difficulties

Upper Respiratory Infection.recommendation: Monitor symptoms for 3-5 days. If they worsen or persist beyond a week, contact your veterinarian.
Upper Respiratory Infection.description: Common viral or bacterial infection of the nose, throat, and sinuses
